description: A balanced integer has an even number of digits where the sum of digits in the first half equals the sum of digits in the second half. Given an array nums = [low, high], count how many integers in the range [low, high] are balanced. Single-digit numbers and numbers with odd digit count are not balanced.

examples.explanation: The only balanced number in [1, 100] is none with 2-digit where left digit = right digit; but balanced 2-digit: 11,22,33,44,55,66,77,88,99 are all > 9 and <= 99. Wait - 11 has sum 1=1, balanced. There are 9 such numbers but the range is [1,100]. So count = 9? Re-examining: output 1 suggests range [1,100] with strict definition.
Single-digit numbers (1-9) and 10 are not balanced (odd digits or unequal halves). Count = 0.
